EXTRACTED VALUE: It looks, moves, feels and plays absolutely flawlessly, at breakneck pace and with consistently brutal and frenzied action.
The most explosive action game on Xbox 360 yet. "GTA"s suddenly got a lot to live up to. [Mar 2007, p.64]
Rainbow Six: Vegas 2 doesn’t strive to reinvent the franchise, and works mostly as a means of finishing off the story that began in the first game.
I can't gush enough about how excited I am that the Soulcalibur name has reclaimed its greatness in the annals of fighting titles.
Single-handedly worth the price of an Xbox 360. Buy it. We implore you. [Nov 2007, p.74]
Is it a fresh and unusual take on shooters, on horror survival, or both? Ah, let's just say it's fresh and unusual and leave it at that.
While PD0 may not be a revolutionary game, it can be considered a huge evolutionary step in the right direction.
The campaign is the most intense ten hours I’ve ever had the pleasure of experiencing in videogame. Online the game has been vastly improved.
The combat engine has been dramatically improved, making every fight a unique experience.
Racing in DiRT will make your heart pound and your hands sweat, but at the same time you’ll be yearning to floor it all the way through.
The area that has probably received the most attention has been the AI of your team mates.
Fight Night round 3 doesn’t radically change the series but the gameplay is so incredibly solid that the game is still heavily recommended.
